info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 21 at 2:34PM EDT until September 21 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Palm Beach.
* WHEN...Until 330 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 234 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Boca Raton, Boynton Beach, Delray Beach, Highland Beach, Kings Point, Dunes Road, Gulf Stream, Fau South Campus and Villages Of Oriole. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
